Howard Township is a township in Story County, Iowa, United States.  As of the 2000 census, its population was 1945.
Geography
Howard Township covers an area of  and contains the incorporated town of Roland and portions of Story City.  According to the USGS, it contains four cemeteries: Sheffield Cemetery, Fosen Cemetery, Roland Cemetery and Peerson Cemetery.
Howard Township contains Long Dick Creek.
15px Interstate 35 runs north and south through the township and County Road E18 runs eastâ€“west.  County Road E18 was formerly Iowa Hwy 221 until it was decommissioned on July 1, 2003, and redesignated as a county road.
